item.title: Flood alert: Upper Bristol Avon area
item.description: River levels are stable or falling. Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Saturday is forecast to be mostly dry with the odd isolated shower. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 18 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Churn and its tributaries
item.description:

A band of rain is expected this morning into the early afternoon (18/01/26), with isolated showers possible tomorrow. River levels are expected to remain high today.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

item.title: Flood alert: Middle Avon Rugby to Bidford
item.description: High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, 17 January 2026. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Severn in Gloucestershire
item.description: River levels remain high but are falling slowly today 18 January 2026. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester.
